message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: private void sendImage(DataOutputStream dataOutputStream, BufferedImage image) throws IOException {
    ByteArrayOutputStream byteArrayOutputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
    ImageIO.write(image, "png", byteArrayOutputStream);
    byte[] imageBytes = byteArrayOutputStream.toByteArray();
    
    dataOutputStream.writeInt(imageBytes.length);
    dataOutputStream.write(imageBytes);
}
<<<explanation>>>: Here is how to send a BufferedImage from Java to Android using a TCP socket:
1. Convert the BufferedImage to a byte array using ByteArrayOutputStream and ImageIO.write.
2. Write the length of the byte array to the DataOutputStream using dataOutputStream.writeInt.
3. Write the byte array to the DataOutputStream using dataOutputStream.write.
On the Android side, you can read the byte array and create a Bitmap using BitmapFactory.decodeByteArray. Make sure to set the correct Bitmap.Config for the image options.
